item.title: Cindy add a quote by Pam Brown
item.description: "One small cat changes coming home to an empty house to coming home." -- Pam Brown

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"When we see religion split into so many thousand of sects, and I may say Christianity itself divided into its thousands also, who are disputing, anathematizing and where the laws permit burning and torturing one another for abstractions which no one of them understand, and which are indeed beyond the comprehension of the human mind, into which of the chambers of this Bedlam would a man wish to thrust himself.
[<i>Letter to George Logan, 12 November 1816</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "The edge of the sea is a strange and beautiful place." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "To stand at the edge of the sea, to sense the ebb and flow of the tides, to feel the breath of a mist moving over a great salt marsh, to watch the flight of shore birds that have swept up and down the surf lines of the continents for untold thousands of years, to see the running of the old eels and the young shad to the sea, is to have knowledge of things that are as nearly eternal as any earthly life can be." -- Rachel Carson
